BC DiagnosticServiceCS CodeSystem

The type of laboratory service used in producing a laboratory result

name: DiagnosticServiceCS
title: BC DiagnosticServiceCS CodeSystem
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC)
description: The type of laboratory service used in producing a laboratory result

concept.definition: Laboratory concerned with cultures, to look for suspected pathogens.
concept.display: Laboratory concerned with cultures, to look for suspected pathogens.

concept.definition: Laboratory responsible for examining samples and specimens for evidence of intestinal parasites such as tapeworms, hookworms, and others.
concept.display: Laboratory responsible for examining samples and specimens for evidence of intestinal parasites such as tapeworms, hookworms, and others.

concept.definition: Laboratory concerned with identification of viruses in specimens such as blood, urine, and cerebrospinal fluid.
concept.display: Laboratory concerned with identification of viruses in specimens such as blood, urine, and cerebrospinal fluid.

concept.definition: Laboratory that works with whole blood to do full blood counts, and blood films as well as many other specialised tests.
concept.display: Laboratory that works with whole blood to do full blood counts, and blood films as well as many other specialised tests.

concept.definition: Laboratory that usually receives serum or plasma and tests the serum for chemicals present in blood.
concept.display: Laboratory that usually receives serum or plasma and tests the serum for chemicals present in blood.

concept.definition: Laboratory that tests for toxins, pharmaceutical and recreational drugs in the blood. Urine and blood samples are submitted to this lab.
concept.display: Laboratory that tests for toxins, pharmaceutical and recreational drugs in the blood. Urine and blood samples are submitted to this lab.

concept.definition: Immunology/Serology laboratory uses the concept of antigen-antibody interaction as a diagnostic tool. Compatibility of transplanted organs is also determined.
concept.display: Immunology/Serology laboratory uses the concept of antigen-antibody interaction as a diagnostic tool. Compatibility of transplanted organs is also determined.

concept.definition: Laboratory or blood bank that determines blood groups, and performs compatibility testing on donor blood and recipients. It also prepares blood components, derivatives, and products for transfusion.
concept.display: Laboratory or blood bank that determines blood groups, and performs compatibility testing on donor blood and recipients. It also prepares blood components, derivatives, and products for transfusion.

concept.definition: Laboratory tests urine for many analytes. Some health care providers have a urinalysis laboratory, while others don't.
concept.display: Laboratory tests urine for many analytes. Some health care providers have a urinalysis laboratory, while others don't.

concept.definition: Surgical, cytopathology, or histopathology laboratory. Surgical pathology examines organs, limbs, tumors, fetuses, and other tissues biopsied in surgery such as breast mastectomies.
concept.display: Surgical, cytopathology, or histopathology laboratory. Surgical pathology examines organs, limbs, tumors, fetuses, and other tissues biopsied in surgery such as breast mastectomies.

concept.definition: Laboratory that mainly performs DNA analysis.
concept.display: Laboratory that mainly performs DNA analysis.

concept.definition: Laboratory that uses blood and other cells to get a karyotype. This can be helpful in prenatal diagnosis (e.g. Down's syndrome) as well as in cancer (some cancers have abnormal chromosomes).
concept.display: Laboratory that uses blood and other cells to get a karyotype. This can be helpful in prenatal diagnosis (e.g. Down's syndrome) as well as in cancer (some cancers have abnormal chromosomes).
